abstract: If economics is the study of the allocation of scarce goods and services, what could be scarcer or more precious than love?
snippet: If economics is the study of the allocation of scarce goods and services, what could be scarcer or more precious than love?
lead_paragraph: AS my fine professor of economics at Columbia, C. Lowell Harriss (who just celebrated his 96th birthday) used to tell us, economics is the study of the allocation of scarce goods and services. What could be scarcer or more precious than love? It is rare, hard to come by and often fragile.

headline.main: Lessons in Love, by Way of Economics
headline.print_headline: Lessons in Love, By Way of Economics
